sentence.Network_cn: 下表中将试图具体列出编目史实.

sentence.Network_en: Gypsum may crystallize on the surface of the phosphate rock particles.
sentence.Network_cn: 石膏会在磷矿颗粒的表面上结晶.

entry.tran: (使)(意见或想法)明确;(使)具体化
entry.def: If you crystallize an opinion or idea, or if it crystallizes, it becomes fixed and definite in someone's mind.

example.ex: He has managed to crystallise the feelings of millions of ordinary Russians...
example.tran: 他弄清了百万普通俄罗斯人的感受。

example.ex: Now my thoughts really began to crystallise.
example.tran: 现在我的想法开始真正成形了。

entry.def: If a substance crystallizes, or something crystallizes it, it turns into crystals.

example.ex: Don't stir or the sugar will crystallise.
...a 19th century technique that actually crystallizes the tin.
example.tran: 19世纪已然能使锡结晶的技术

means.word_mean: 1. cause to take on a definite and clear shape;
2. make free from confusion or ambiguity; make clear;

sentences.sentence: "Clear up the question of who is at fault"

means.word_mean: 3. cause to form crystals or assume crystalline form;

auth_sentence.content: The writers who have most...revelation about them do not crystallize their revelation into formulae.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The writers who have most...revelation about them do not crystallize their revelation into formulae.

sentences.cn: 雨水在低温情况下结晶变成雪。

sentences.en: After weeks of work, our plan for a vacation trip crystallized.
sentences.cn: 经过几周的工作, 我们的度假计划终于成型了。
